macros.sourceContext:
> | {{APIRef("CSS Custom Highlight API")}} ^ |

The add() method of the {{domxref("Highlight")}} interface adds a new {{domxref("Range")}} object to a highlight, to be styled using the {{domxref("css_custom_highlight_api", "CSS Custom Highlight API", "", "nocode")}}.

|

Highlight is a {{jsxref("Set")}}-like object, so this is similar to using {{jsxref("Set.add()")}}.

value.content:
The add() method of the Highlight interface adds a new Range object to a highlight, to be styled using the CSS Custom Highlight API.

Highlight is a Set-like object, so this is similar to using Set.add().

value.title: Syntax
value.content:
js

add(range)

value.title: Parameters
value.content:
range

A Range object to add to the Highlight.

value.title: Examples
value.content:
The code snippet below shows how to add two ranges to a new highlight object:

js

const highlight = new Highlight();

const range1 = new Range();
const range2 = new Range();

highlight.add(range1).add(range2);

console.log(highlight.size); // 2

value.title: See also
value.content:
• The CSS Custom Highlight API
  • CSS Custom Highlight API: The Future of Highlighting Text Ranges on the Web
